column4: Hey guys, I was wondering if someone could answer a question I had about transfering files across two computers in the same room.. or if anyone could direct me to the proper channel?
over what medium?
Transfering 556 MB of Music files from one computer to another when both are hooked up to a wired router.
take your pick, scp, ftp, samba, etc etc :)
I don't know how to use any of those :(
I'm being a noob and trying to transfer it through an IM client. :P
what operating systems?
XP on source and Ubuntu on Destination

install ssh on the ubuntu (sudo apt-get install ssh) then download winscp on the windows box. When you open winscp you will just enter the IP of the ubuntu box and your user/pass and you will see the folders on the ubuntu box. After that its drag and drop. Probably the least steps aproach
Sounds simple enough. Thank you :)
np, good luck
Can I get the terminal to output the IP of the computer with a certain command?
ifconfig
And the IP that I'm using is the local (192.168) or the network for that computer?
the local. the one rite after "address" for the eth0 most likely
Okay. Thanks so much for all your help :D
no problem :)
It's working!!
cool :)
This will be really useful later on, thanks so much :)
no problem it isn't the fastest way but it is pretty reliable
And it's easy, which is nice for a nooblet like me :P
thank Ubuntu devs for that. They do a great job setting up ssh with no extra config needed
I can tell.. it just does its job right out of the box
